title: Shooting incident reported in Katunayake, one injured
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in the Heenatiyana area of Katunayake, police said.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the Intertropical Convergence Zone (where winds from the Northern and Southern Hemispheres converge) is currently affecting the island’s weather.

title: Vatican and Italy prepare for Pope Francis’ funeral: 2,000 police officers to ensure security
byline: On Saturday, April 26, 2025, the funeral of Pope Francis will take place in Rome.

title: PM Harini offers condolences at Vatican Embassy on Pope Francis’s passing
byline: The Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, paid a solemn visit to the Embassy of the Vatican in Colombo yesterday (25) to offer condolences on behalf of the Government and the people of Sri Lanka on the passing of the Archbishop of Buenos Aires and the regional leader in Argentina, His Holiness Pope Francis.

title: More details revealed on Katunayake shooting
byline: Police report that the individual injured in a shooting incident in the Heenatiyana area of Katunayake this morning (26) has been identified as 29-year-old Udara Chathuranga, a resident of the same area.

title: BYD launches world’s largest car carrier with 9,200 vehicle capacity
byline: China’s leading electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer BYD has officially launched the world’s largest car carrier ship, ‘BYD Shenzhen.’

title: Royalty and presidents to join multitude of mourners at Pope Francis’ funeral
byline: Royalty, presidents, prime ministers and a legion of faithful will pay their last respects to Pope Francis on Saturday at a funeral Mass in St. Peter’s Square to honour his sometimes turbulent papacy.

title: India, Pakistan exchange gunfire for 2nd day as ties plummet after attack
byline: Indian and Pakistani troops exchanged gunfire for a second straight day on Saturday as ties plummeted between the two nuclear-armed neighbours after an attack on tourists blamed on Pakistani militants killed 26 in India’s Kashmir region.

title: Teacher training for new education reforms to begin in May – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says the training of teachers required for the new education reforms will commence in May, and that contracts granted to political affiliates in local government institutions will be brought to an end following the upcoming Local Government elections.

title: Sri Lanka to compete in Mixed 400x4 relay at 2025 World Athletics Relays
byline: The Sri Lankan team has qualified to compete in the Mixed 400x4 relay event at the World Athletics Relays 2025.

title: India and Pakistan’s Kashmir fallout hits economy too
byline: Rapidly deteriorating relations between India and Pakistan over a deadly shooting in Kashmir are starting to have small but prickly economic consequences for both nations.

title: Day of mourning in Sri Lanka as Vatican prepares for Pope Francis’s funeral
byline: A National Day of Mourning was declared in Sri Lanka today (April 26) in view of the funeral rites of the late His Holiness Pope Francis.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’: Over 400,000 devotees in Kandy as organizers make another request
byline: The “Siri Dalada Vandanawa,” the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Temple of Tooth Relic in Kandy, is continuing to attract massive crowds despite organizers and authorities pleading from the public not to join lengthy queues.

title: ‘India, Pakistan must exercise restraint’: UN Security Council condemns Pahalgam terror attack
byline: The United Nations Security Council condemned the Pahalgam terror attack and said those responsible for the killings should be held accountable.

title: Watch Live: Pope Francis’ funeral begins at St. Peter’s Square
byline: The funeral Mass for Pope Francis is underway in a packed St. Peter’s Square.

title: Massive fire erupts at Lahore’s Allama Iqbal Airport, flights cancelled
byline: A massive fire erupted at Allama Iqbal International Airport in Lahore, Pakistan, on Saturday, leading to the cancellation of all flights.

title: LG Polls: Over 100 political party supporters arrested
byline: A total of 28 candidates and 111 political party supporters have been arrested in relation to complaints pertaining to the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election, Police said.

title: 24 schools closed due to “Siri Dalada Vandanawa” to reopen on Monday
byline: A total of 24 schools in and around Kandy that were closed due to “Siri Dalada Vandanawa,” the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, will reopen on Monday (28 April), said the Chief Secretary of the Central Province.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm likely in several provinces
byline: Heavy showers above 100 mm are likely at some places in the Central, Uva, Eastern, North-western and North-central provinces and in the Vavuniya and Mullaitivu districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Police seize cars following viral video of alleged street race
byline: Police have seized two cars following investigations based on a video widely circulated on social media seemingly of a street race involving two cars driving along the High Level road from Galawilawatta to Makumbura within the Homagama Police Division.

title: Tri-forces humanitarian team returns after Myanmar relief mission
byline: The specially deployed Tri Forces Humanitarian Assistance and Relief Team returned to the island today (April 26) after the successful completion of their emergency relief mission in Myanmar.
